content.question: The base of a loudspeaker is determined by the two curves <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>=</mo> <mo>âˆ’</mo> <mfrac> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> <mrow> <mn>10</mn> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </math> for as shown in the figure above. For this loudspeaker, the cross sections perpendicular to the x-axis are squares. What is the volume of the loudspeaker, in cubic units?

topic.text: 8.7: Volumes with Cross Sections - Squares and Rectangles

skill.text: Skill 3.D: Apply an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test.
